ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A condition that differs from the usual physical or mental state.: A magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) pulse sequence that uses an inversion recovery technique to null fluids present in the imaging area, improving clarity of the object of interest.

Concepts.definition: A condition that differs from the usual physical or mental state.
A magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) pulse sequence that uses an inversion recovery technique to null fluids present in the imaging area, improving clarity of the object of interest.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: To improve the quality of something; make better or more attractive.: Substances administered during imaging procedures that allows delineation of internal structures. Contrast agents appear opaque due to the difference in absorption of X-rays or other electromagnetic waves and surrounding tissue.

Concepts.definition: To improve the quality of something; make better or more attractive.

Substances administered during imaging procedures that allows delineation of internal structures. Contrast agents appear opaque due to the difference in absorption of X-rays or other electromagnetic waves and surrounding tissue.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The process of the diffusion or accumulation in a tissue or cells of a substance not normal to it or in amounts above normal. (NCI): A magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) pulse sequence that uses an inversion recovery technique to null fluids present in the imaging area, improving clarity of the object of interest.

Concepts.definition: The process of the diffusion or accumulation in a tissue or cells of a substance not normal to it or in amounts above normal. (NCI)
A magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) pulse sequence that uses an inversion recovery technique to null fluids present in the imaging area, improving clarity of the object of interest.
A small lump, swelling or collection of tissue.
